paper_title.en: Photocatalytic Cancer (HeLa) Cell-Killing Enhanced with Cu-TiO2 Nanocomposite

description.en: The metallic Cu nanoparticles have been successfully deposited on the heterogeneous TiO2 surface by the borohydride reduction of copper nitrate in water/CH3CN mixture under Ar atmosphere. The catalytic activity of the Cu-TiO2 nanocomposite was evaluated by the application to a photocatalytic cancer cell-killing under UV-visible light irradiation. Based on the obtained results, a plausible mechanism was proposed.

paper_title.en: Photocatalytic Cancer (HeLa) Cell-Killing Enhanced with Cu-TiO2 Nanocomposite

paper_title.ja: A new type of solid state solar cell based on Fe2O3 , SiC and crystal growth inhibitors
Fabrication, N-doping mechanism and evaluation of N-doped TiO2 thin films based on laser ablation method
One-step and large scale synthesis of nonmetal doped TiO2 submicrospheres and their photocatalytic activity

paper_title.en: One-step and large scale synthesis of nonmetal doped TiO2 submicrospheres and their photocatalytic activity
Wet-type Fe2O3 solar cells based on Fe2O3 films prepared by laser ablation: Drastic temperature effect

description.en: A wet-type solar cell based on Fe2O3 films prepared by the laser ablation method was investigated. The performance was increased drastically by the thermal treatment of the Fe2O3/FTO films. This enhancement effect is caused by the improvement of the binding interface between FTO and Fe2O3. (C) 2009 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Mineralizer-Assisted Shape-Controlled Synthesis, Characterization, and Photocatalytic Evaluation of CdS Microcrystals

description.en: High-quality, well-crystallized, single-crystal, wurtzite CdS hexagonal microtowers (with and without tubular structure) and CdS with octahedral geometry were successfully synthesized by tuning the solvent ratio of water and ethanol for the first time on a large scale without using any catalysts or templates. The products were characterized by X-ray diffraction (XRD), energy-dispersive X-ray spectrometry, transmission electron microscopy, and field emission scanning electron microscopy. CdS with microtowers, octahedral geometry, and hexagonal plates was formed by thermal decomposition of cadmium thiocyanate at 400 degrees C under open atmospheric conditions. The influence of solvent., initial precursor concentration, decomposition temperature, and time on the morphology of CdS was investigated, and the results were discussed. The XRD results showed that the cadmium thiocyanate complex is completely decomposed into CdS at 300 degrees C for 2 h and the wurtzite phase was formed under all experimental conditions, which opens a door for well-crystallized, single-phase CdS synthesis oil a large scale. The diffuse reflectance spectra showed that CdS microtowers have strong visible light absorption compared with the octahedral geometry, revealing the existence of a profound shape-property relationship of CdS. The CdS microtowers with a Pt cocatalyst showed a high rate of photocatalytic hydrogen production from water containing 0.1 M Na(2)S and 0.1 M Na(2)SO(3) as sacrificial reagents under visible light irradiation (lambda >= 400 nm). The possible growing mechanism of various types of the US morphology was also discussed.

paper_title.en: Mineralizer-Assisted Shape-Controlled Synthesis, Characterization, and Photocatalytic Evaluation of CdS Microcrystals

description.en: High-quality, well-crystallized, single-crystal, wurtzite CdS hexagonal microtowers (with and without tubular structure) and CdS with octahedral geometry were successfully synthesized by tuning the solvent ratio of water and ethanol for the first time on a large scale without using any catalysts or templates. The products were characterized by X-ray diffraction (XRD), energy-dispersive X-ray spectrometry, transmission electron microscopy, and field emission scanning electron microscopy. The diffuse reflectance spectra showed that CdS microtowers have strong visible light absorption compared with the octahedral geometry, revealing the existence of a profound shape-property relationship of CdS. paper_title.en: Wet-type Fe2O3 solar cells based on Fe2O3 films prepared by laser ablation: Drastic temperature effect

description.en: A wet-type solar cell based on Fe2O3 films prepared by the laser ablation method was investigated. The performance was increased drastically by the thermal treatment of the Fe2O3/FTO films. This enhancement effect is caused by the improvement of the binding interface between FTO and Fe2O3. (C) 2009 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Enhanced Photocatalytic Cytotoxic Activity of Au@TiO2 Nanopellets against Human Epithelial Carcinoma (HeLa) Cells

description.en: The photocatalytic cytotoxicity of metallic gold-capped TiO2 (Au@TiO2) colloidal nanopellets was investigated against HeLa cells under UV-vis light irradiation. The morphological structure and the surface species of Au@TiO2 nanopellets were determined by using UV-vis absorption spectroscopy, TEM, SEM, XPS, XRD, and EDX techniques. The photocatalytic cytotoxicity of Au@TiO2 nanopellets was compared with that of TiO2 alone under the same experimental conditions. The cytotoxic effect of Au@TiO2 nanopellets was found to be 100%, whereas that of commercial TiO2 (P25) was ca. 50%.

paper_title.en: Cytotoxic Evaluation of Ag@TiO2 Core-Shell Composite Nanoclusters against Cancer Cells

description.en: A Ag metal core-TiO2 shell (A-@TiO2) composite nanocluster photocatalyst with uniform size and shape was successfully synthesized by a new simple citrate reduction method. The cytotoxicity of colloidal Ag@TiO2 composite nanoclusters was evaluated against cancer (HeLa) cells under UV-vis irradiation. Ag@TiO2 composite nanoclusters were characterized by using UV-vis absorption spectroscopy, TEM, SEM, XPS. XRD, and EDX techniques. It was found that Ag@TiO2 nanoclusters at low concentrations kill HeLa cells by 100%, whereas TiO2 nanoparticles alone kill only ca. 30% at the same concentrations.

paper_title.en: Cytotoxic Evaluation of Ag@TiO2 Core-Shell Composite Nanoclusters against Cancer Cells

description.en: A Ag metal core-TiO2 shell (A-@TiO2) composite nanocluster photocatalyst with uniform size and shape was successfully synthesized by a new simple citrate reduction method. The cytotoxicity of colloidal Ag@TiO2 composite nanoclusters was evaluated against cancer (HeLa) cells under UV-vis irradiation. It was found that Ag@TiO2 nanoclusters at low concentrations kill HeLa cells by 100%, whereas TiO2 nanoparticles alone kill only ca. 30% at the same concentrations.

paper_title.en: Simple new synthesis of copper nanoparticles in water/acetonitrile mixed solvent and their characterization

description.en: Copper nanoparticles were successfully synthesized by the borohydride reduction of copper nitrate salt in water/CH(3)CN mixed solvent under inert argon-purged conditions. Cu nanoparticles were synthesized in large-scale production for the first time by introducing CH(3)CN into water and preventing oxidation during the preparation of nanoparticles. Nanoparticles were characterized by using UV-visible absorption spectroscopy, transmission electron microscopy (TEM), X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) and X-ray diffraction (XRD) techniques. High resolution TEM Pictures showed the formation of homogeneous cubic-structured copper nanoparticles with sizes less than 100 nm. This new kind of synthesis method shows the excellent stability compared with that of citrate-protected copper nanoparticles, which may provide an efficient way to improve the fine tuning of the structure and size of copper nanoparticles. (C) 2009 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Synthesis of N, C Codoped Hierarchical Porous Microsphere ZnS As a Visible Light-Responsive Photocatalyst

description.en: A new N, C codoped visible light responsive hierarchical porous ZnS photocatalysts have been successfully synthesized by using a simple procedure in large scale without using catalyst or template. This is a first example of a nonmetal doped sulfide semiconductor photocatalyst working under visible light irradiation. N, C codoped ZnS catalysts were formed by thermal decomposition of zinc isothiocyanate at 300, 400, and 500 degrees C under open atmospheric conditions. The influences of various experimental conditions on the morphology of the catalysts have been investigated. The synthesized catalysts were characterized by the required analytical techniques. The N, C codoped catalysts possess well-crystallized wurtzite structure and have excellent visible light absorption when compared to undoped ZnS. Elemental and XPS analyses confirmed the presence of both nitrogen and carbon elements in ZnS. The chemical natures of nitrogen and carbon have been discussed on the basis of FTIR and XPS results. The visible light induced photocatalytic activity of these catalysts were investigated by using AO7 as a model pollutant and results showed that the synthesized catalysts have excellent photocatalytic activity. A possible growth mechanism of the hierarchical porous photocatalysts was proposed.

description.en: A new N, C codoped visible light responsive hierarchical porous ZnS photocatalysts have been successfully synthesized by using a simple procedure in large scale without using catalyst or template. This is a first example of a nonmetal doped sulfide semiconductor photocatalyst working under visible light irradiation. paper_title.en: New Simple Synthesis of Cu-TiO2 Nanocomposite: Highly Enhanced Photocatalytic Killing of Epithelia Carcinoma (HeLa) Cells

description.en: Cu-TiO2 nanocomposites with different Cu/TiO2 molar ratios were synthesized by a new simple chemical reduction method. The morphological structure and the surface species of Cu-TiO2 nanocomposites were determined by using UV-vis absorption spectroscopy, TEM, XPS, XRD, and EDX techniques. The photocatalytic cytotoxicity of Cu-TiO2 nanocomposites was investigated under UV-vis light irradiation. The cytotoxicity depends on the molar ratio of Cu to TiO2, ranging from 0.2 to 5.

paper_title.en: New Simple Synthesis of Cu-TiO2 Nanocomposite: Highly Enhanced Photocatalytic Killing of Epithelia Carcinoma (HeLa) Cells

description.en: Cu-TiO2 nanocomposites with different Cu/TiO2 molar ratios were synthesized by a new simple chemical reduction method. The morphological structure and the surface species of Cu-TiO2 nanocomposites were determined by using UV-vis absorption spectroscopy, TEM, XPS, XRD, and EDX techniques. The photocatalytic cytotoxicity of Cu-TiO2 nanocomposites was investigated under UV-vis light irradiation. The cytotoxicity depends on the molar ratio of Cu to TiO2, ranging from 0.2 to 5.
